column1: full, swinging into the pads, whips it uppishly to Amla at short midwicket. Falls just short.
full at off stump, minimal movement inwards, nice stride forward to defend
full at middle stump, swinging down leg. He anticipates the swing, shuffles across and flicks it past short fine leg
full, wide outside off stump, pushes it to cover point with a short stride
good length, in the corridor, opens the face as he defends this on the up to point
back of a length outside off stump, skids through at a nice height and he pounces on the up to place this between extra cover and cover point
back of a length, straight through in the corridor, back foot defence
good length, corridor, pushed on the up to find mid-off
length in the corridor again, shuffles across to try and whip it square on the leg side, can only push it to mid-on

back of a length, that corridor line again, but this is marginally short. Billings upright as he pulls this over mid-on on the up. Didn't connect that too well, but it was enough to go over the infield
short, just outside off stump, this time he's in full control as he hangs back and spanks this wide of mid-on
good length, nipping in at off stump, he pushes on the up to mid-on to steal a run
full outside off, dances across to meet it on the pitch, finds Amla at midwicket with the flick
good length, slight movement away, follows it with his hands and pokes it to cover point
back of a length at off stump, drives on the up, too early on the shot. It's back down the pitch at the bowler
misses the yorker, low full toss at middle stump. Flicks this right off the middle but Amla dives one-handed to his right at midwicket to cut it off
wow. This is full outside off stump. He's put a stride across, gotten on one knee and swept him behind square.
good length outside off, drives on the up to mid-off's left

good length, angled down towards the leg stump, he steps out early. Not to the pitch, tickles it to short fine...whose throw is fumbled by Morgan who is backing up the non-striker's end. No damage though, Samson wasn't aware
good length, angling in at leg stump, flicked behind square on the leg side
back of a length at middle stump, steps out and bunts it to deep midwicket on the up
back of a length at middle stump, pushed off the back foot through the open midwicket area
good length, angling in at leg stump, steps out and pushes it wide of mid-on
good length at leg stump, tapped on the up to mid-on
back of a length at off stump, defended back down the pitch
fierce. Billings is looking busy today. Steps down the track against Punjab's fastest bowler, meets it on the pitch at a middle stump line and hammers it past his partner at the other end
steps out again, this time it's slightly short, but he throws his arms at it and uses his wrists to pull this past a diving midwicket
woeful bowling. Overpitched, angling down leg side, put away off his toes with ease through the long leg region
back of a length, climbing in at the waist, clips the thigh guard as he looks to glance it fine
back of a length at middle stump, gets on top of the bounce and glances it to through square leg
good length at off stump, driven down the pitch on the up, bowler cuts it off
slower ball, floated full at middle stump, picks it and waits before closing his wrists on the drive. Finds midwicket
good length, angled in at the pads. Lifts his front leg as he's on to this too soon. Wants to hit it square, but chips it towards long-on
back of the hand slower ball, good length, outside off stump. Walks into it and drops it with soft hands to backward point
nails the yorker, it's headed for off stump. Samson opens the face and deflects it to backward point
back of a length at off stump, sits up nicely and Samson elegantly dispatches this wide of long-on with a flat-bat
good length outside off stump, goes on the back foot and drops it into the off side
good length at off stump, watchfully defended back to the bowler
good length, flat and full at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket to bring up fifty for the stand

back of a length outside off stump, this spins a long way as Billings goes for the reverse sweep. He's beaten, Saha takes the bails off and appeals. This has been sent upstairs. But we won't see if the batsman was in, because the bowler has overstepped. Free hit.
back of a length at middle stump, spins away as he slogs across the line. Can't get enough power as a result, long-on cleans up to his right

holes out to long-off. Tossed up generously at leg stump. He offers the angled bat to try and hit skywards into the leg side, but he's not to the pitch. The ball spins enough to get the outside half of the bat and it is lobbed straight to Morgan
full at middle stump, leans in to drive this between long-on and deep midwicket. New batsman Karun Nair runs hard to complete the second
back of a length, climbing at an off stump line, defended off the back foot to point
short ball, climbs at his chest, jumps up to defend it

Nair's wretched run continues. Goes for the short one again, this is under his arm-pit and he fends at it to try and pick runs fine. But Saha is across to catch it and the umpire raises the finger. Good catch too, he dove to his left with both hands and performed a graceful tumble to keep it in
persists with the short ball, but this is angled too far down leg side to cause trouble
back of a length at off stump, gets on his toes to defend into the off side
good length outside off stump, short stride as he turns it to sweeper cover with an open face
short ball outside off. Billings anticipates it and backs away down the leg side. He's not in control as he wafts at this away from the body. Gets an outside edge that balloons wide of Saha
short, down the leg side, well past the batsman's shot
good length at off stump, drops it in front of point off the front foot
good length at middle stump, shuffles back and across and taps it to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, turns away sharply, Iyer pushes with no feet with a closed face, it's back down the pitch
full at off stump, driven straight to extra cover
good length outside off stump, not to the pitch of this but he's used his wrists beautifully to squeeze this past point on the up
full at off stump, driven down to long-off with a full face
good length at middle stump, hangs deep in the crease and pushes off the back foot to deep midwicket
short at middle stump, goes for the pull but this one has bitten into the pitch and come off a little slower. Slides under the bat and lands in front of Saha
short ball, was headed down leg side, but Billings walks at it and has to back away to drop this down towards mid-on
back of a length, angled into the thigh, watches it closely and tickles it fine. Attempted legcutter gone wrong
short ball, angled into the ribs, leaps off the ground and uses soft-hands to drop this in front of deep square
good length, drifted down leg side again, and this time he whips it off the pads to bisect deep square and fine leg
good length, angling in at leg stump again, he offers the full face and pushes it to long-on
good length at off stump, pushes forward and pushes it to point
good length at middle stump, steps down the track and pushes on the up to long-on
good length, drifting in at off stump, pushed to sweeper cover off the front foot
back of a length at off stump, steps out, punches on the up to long-off
full outside off stump, steps out and drags it across the line to get it between deep midwicket and long-on
good length ball, strikes him on the back leg as he attempts to sweep, but he was outside the line. He was lazy as he ran this, short third man would've run him close with a direct hit
slower ball, good length at off stump, watches it closely and taps it into the covers region

back of a length at middle stump, hangs back, gets the front leg out of the way and swats across the line. Gets it a little high on the bat, but he has got it past midwicket and long-on can't get to it
slower ball outside off, gives him the charge and pushes it to extra cover off the front foot
back of a length outside off, opens the face too early to try and find third man, beaten

good length at off stump, stands tall to try and lift this on the up over midwicket. He gets it off the toe of the bat and finds Morgan at long-on who has to take maybe five steps in before camping under this and taking it in front of his eyes
slower ball at off stump, walks across the stumps and drops this into the off side to bring up his second fifty in the IPL
back of a length at middle stump, looks to pull but this one skids on and cramps him. In the end, it's a mistimed shovel to deep midwicket
dropped short at middle stump, he's back in the crease like he's been there for hour. Pulls it gracefully over midwicket, but deep square was straight enough to cut it off

as always, he steps out before the release. Axar adjusts and throws this wide, back of a length, outside off stump. He's beaten for length, but goes through with the shot and just manages to get it to the extra cover boundary
back of a length outside off, punched to extra cover
steps out again, not to the pitch again, but this time he can't get runs off it. Axar drops it back of a length, gets it to straighten slightly. He slogs across the line and finds long-on
dropped short outside off, finds cover point with the cut shot
full outside off stump, driven to long-off
tossed up outside off from around the wicket, steps down the track and bludgeons this wide of long-off
good length, angling in at middle stump, pushes into the open leg side. Maxwell gets across quickly to keep it to one
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
good length, angled in at leg stump, catches the pads as he looks to flick it square
flighted full at off stump, thumped hard, straight to long-off
back of a length outside off, hangs back and punches this straight back at the bowler who is slow at getting down on this and drops a tough chance
good length outside off, driven on the up to long-off
short, wide, whack. Stays put and slaps it in front of point on the up

dropped short at middle stump, swivels and takes one hand off as he pulls this wide of long-on....where Morgan does well to reach it but bungles it as the last moment with the slide. Gets in a tangle and gives away four
good length outside off stump, chopped on the up to point

lucky. Walks down at him and looks to send this full ball over the midwicket boundary. Gets too close to it and gets an inside edge that just about rolls past the leg stump and forces short fine to chase and slide to his left
bouncer at middle stump, looks to dispatch him straight away with a pull shot, but he's too late on it. Slices a lob to mid-off inside the circle
looks for the slower ball, misfires, full and down the leg side
back of a length outside off, watches it onto the bat and expertly squeezes this between backward point and short third man
full at leg stump, looks to work this through the leg side, gets a leading edge to mid-off
overpitched outside off stump, stays put in the crease and drives it to mid-off off the bottom of the bat
full outside off stump, gets it off the toe again as he looks to drive expansively through the off side. This time it rolls back down the pitch slowly and breaks the stumps at the other end
oh dear. Lands this full toss wide outside the off stump, wide of the pitch, in fact
power. Good length outside off, this time the front leg goes out of the way and he absolutely smashes this back over the umpire's head
full outside off stump, no feet as he tries to drive this through the off side, thick inside edge into the leg side
misses the yorker by a long way, it's a full toss well above waist height. Flies past the off stump and gives Saha an akward bounce. Gives Delhi a free hit.
wallop! Slower ball, good length ball outside off. He's waiting for it and he slaps this over long-on and into the roof above the second-tier
good length at middle stump, slower ball, works it behind square off the pads
short ball at middle stump, hits the pull off the middle and finds deep square leg
slower bouncer at leg stump, ducks under it
slower ball, good length at off stump, tapped to point off the back foot
low full toss wide outside off stump from around the wicket, slices it over point and it rolls away feebly to the square boundary there
bouncer at off stump, he's through the pull early. Thick inside edge that lands next to his back boot. They steal a single as Saha runs in
length ball at off stump, whips it on the up between deep midwicket and long-on, got that off the bottom of the bat
low full toss at off stump, can't get under it. Tries to go inside-out, right off the bottom and lands harmlessly in front of extra cover
well his first dot ball in this phase will be a dismissial. Dropped short at middle stump, not a very smart ball. Morris couldn't get elevation on his pull, picks out deep square leg
length ball outside off stump, punches this on the up, wide of long-off
pushed flat, back of a length, wide outside off stump. He fetches it from there, pulls it wide of long-on
back of a length at middle stump, backs away and swivels to lift it over short fine. Doesn't connect, catches it on the pad
good length, angled wide across off stump, this time he drags it over the bowler's head, but long-on cuts it off
good length, angled in at middle stump, swats across the line, bottom of the bat, to deep midwicket
good length at leg stump, this time he leans in, gets under it nicely and sweeps it over the long leg boundary
short and wide outside off stump, once more he drags it from out there. Pull shot, flat-bat, not off the middle but just over long-on
low full toss, wide outside off stump. Reaches out for it and has to take one hand off in the end, but he taps it to point's right with an open face
length ball outside off stump, right in the arc for a slap across the line. That's exactly what he's done. Hits it wide of long-on
back of a length, slower ball outside off stump, he's through the slog early this time, beaten
slower ball, back of a length outside off, watches it closely, reaches out and drags it into the leg side with a pull
low full toss at off stump from around the wicket, leans in to get under this and lifts it sweetly over the bowler's head. Long-on is quite straight, but not straight enough

makes it a huge over. Slower bouncer attempted again, middle stump line. He pulls from in front of his body. It loops to Manan Vohra's right at long leg who tries to flick it back into play with an outstretched right arm, but can't quite time it
make that 1 off 12 balls. Back of a length, swings back in towards off stump, punched back to the bowler
some swing again, towards middle stump this time. Vohra clips it away to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump. Hashim shuffles across, looking to clip into the on side with the swing, but there's no swing, and he squirts it out into the covers instead
full on off stump, driven firmly on the up and Samson dives to his right to stop it at mid-off. Saved three there
back of a length outside off, stabbed to backward point

ooh, nearly. Looks to drive one that's too full and too close to off stump to be hitting into the covers, and inside-edges it. He's lucky the ball stops a foot or so after hitting the bat, because that could have rolled onto the stumps
shortish, angling into the legs. Amla pulls straight to short fine leg. Could have put that away for four if he'd placed it better
back of a length close to off stump, punched to long-off
fullish on middle stump, clipped to long-on

gone! He sees fine leg inside the circle and looks for the cute paddle past the fielder. Picked the wrong ball for it, though. Wasn't short enough for it, and it hurried on, sneaked past his bat, and hit him on the pad. Big appeal from Nadeem before Yashwant Barde raised his finger. Hit him in line, and Hawkeye says it straightened enough to hit a good chunk of leg stump
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to push that to the left of cover
back of a length again, looks to make room to punch but this goes on with the arm and cramps him. Can only jam his bat down defensively
length ball on middle stump, presses forward, front leg to the leg side of the line, and opens his bat face to squeeze a single to deep point
a couple of steps down the pitch, and that's the first boundary of the innings. Back of a length on leg stump, and he clears his front leg to club it away to the midwicket boundary
a bit of room, and Amla plays a stand-and-deliver flat-bat slap but hits it straight to mid-off moving to his left

shortish, homing in on Saha's stomach, swivels to swat that towards short fine leg. They take on Mishra's arm and get a single. Throw is at the bowler's end - Saha would probably have been out had it hit the stumps
wide yorker, good change-up. Amla reaches out to try and slap it away, but can't put bat to ball
back of a length, too much width. Amla says thank you for the swinging room, and flat-bats over mid-off
makes a lot of room, and flays a back-of-a-length off-stump ball over backward point. Top hand came off the handle, but it didn't matter

down the track now, and he gets closer to the pitch than he'd have liked, maybe. Hits it in the air, straight to extra-cover, where Zaheer claims a low catch. They're checking with the third umpire - soft signal is out. Fingers seem to be under the ball, and his hand seems to be an inch or so above the turf. Yup, he's gone.
flat on off stump, defended off the back foot
ooh, stops on the pitch as he comes forward to defend. Ball pops up in the air but falls well short of the bowler
fuller now, clipped to long-on
back of a length on off stump, and Amla is playing this shot well today. Clears his front leg and flat-bats over wide mid-off
fullish on middle and off. Stays leg-side of the ball, doesn't really come forward, defends into the off side
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed to backward point
shot. That's a full ball on off stump, and the trademark Amla shuffle has manufactured a boundary. Fine leg is in the circle, and he gets across to glance it to the fielder's right

full-toss, knee-high, and Amla has picked out deep square leg! I think he was looking to hit that a little finer, but it may have been a slower ball - slower than he thought, at least - and he hit his flick straight to the fielder, off the leading edge or that side of his bat anyway
fullish on off stump, pushed into the covers for a quick single. Billings moved to his right from extra-cover and fired a throw at the keeper's end. Morgan was gone if he'd hit
a touch short outside off, and he rocks back to slap that to the right of cover, where Billings makes a super diving stop
short on off stump and Morgan is in position in a flash to pull that away through midwicket. Didn't really have to move much at all, from his wide stance
back of a length on leg stump, clipped to the right of square leg

shortish on middle and leg. Miller steps across to pull into the square-leg region. Wasn't as short as the one Morgan pulled for four, and consequently he couldn't get the same kind of power into this shot
back of a length close to off stump, chopped down to backward point
back of a length outside off, guided down to third man
ooh, that was quick, and it may have come back in just a touch. Back of a length, Miller was looking to defend with a straight bat, and it just zipped past his inside edge
full at off stump, clears the front leg and hammers this to long-off's left
back of a length on middle and off, shuffles across to tuck that down to fine leg
full on middle and leg, whipped in the air, on the bounce, to deep square leg
yikes, line goes horribly wrong. Back of a length, maybe wants to bowl a leg-stump line and cramp Miller. Ends up whanging it three feet wide of leg stump
length ball on middle and leg. Looks to push towards mid-off, with the angle, only manages an inside edge down to long leg
down the track and Morris flummoxes Miller with a slower short ball, angling a long way away from him. Looks to pull, can't put bat to ball
full on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length, pitching on off and slanting further away. No footwork from Miller, looks to jab at it and the ball beats his outside edge

back of a length on leg stump, looks to shuffle across and work it through backward square leg. Misses, the ball hits his thigh pad, and the combined effort of swivelling through his shot and running to the other end makes him slip and stumble a third of the way through his run
shortish outside off, looks to slap it through point and misses

down the track and Cummins bowls an off-stump ball on a nice length - not full enough to hit down the ground, not short enough to cut. Goes for option 2 and chops it into the pitch off the inside edge. They sneak a quick run
pace, lots of it. Not for the first time this over, a batsman looks to flay a shortish ball through point and gets beaten - a little late on his shot
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, goes deep in his crease to pull to long-on
was that an offbreak? Yup. Pitches outside leg on a good length, and he flicks it away through square leg
floated up outside off, googly this time. Looks for the big slog-sweep and can't put bat to ball
another googly, beautiful length. Miller doesn't know which way it's going. Stretches out and pushes hard with his hands in defence. Beats his outside edge easily
another offbreak, quickish, turning from middle to off, clipped to long-on
quick, flat legbreak wide outside off. Not short enough to cut and he ends up chopping it down into the pitch
back of a length outside off, punched away to the left of deep point
full outside off, and Morgan puts it away, flat-bats it to the right of mid-off
shortish on off stump, pulled to long-on
ooh, lucky. Length ball angling across, maybe a tiny bit of movement back in. Looks to drive on the up through the covers and inside-edges it past his leg stump
short, wide, slapped away to the left of the diving backward point fielder. Not even a despairing sprint and dive from the sweeper can cut that off. Mishra dived at point, Corey at sweeper cover
another cuttable ball, and this time he cuts in the air and Karun Nair takes the catch at backward point. He was initially moving to his left, and in the end had to adjust and fall to his right
starts another over with a googly, slapped away through point
full on middle and off, defended into the covers
Gone! Maxwell goes for the big slog from an off-stump line, is hitting that against the turn, top-edges it, and can only hit it down deep midwicket's throat
back of a length on off stump, legbreak, clipped with the turn to deep midwicket
back of a length, googly, pitches outside off, turns further away. Punched into the covers

tossed up wide of off, looks like another googly, but he doesn't mind hitting against the turn. Connects sweetly and sends it soaring a long way beyond the midwicket boundary. Nope, I've watched a replay and that was a legbreak.
full outside off. Shuffles across to flick to deep midwicket
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
full, fairly wide outside off, driven firmly and straight to extra-cover
full on off stump, flat-batted to long-off
ooh. Another fortuitous inside-edge from Miller. Steps out and ends up yorking himself against a full ball outside off. Inside-edges his drive past leg stump and all the way to the fine leg boundary
dropped. Driven hard, a full ball outside off, and it's put down by Zaheer diving low to his right from cover. Got both hands to it.
back of a length googly, turning towards leg stump, clipped away through square leg
another googly, turning towards off stump this time, punched into the covers
another googly. Not short enough to cut and he inside-edges into the ground and up to slip
fuller now, driven to long-on
another googly, looks to punch through cover, is too early into his shot and inside-edges back to the bowler
fuller now, driven with an open face through point
in the blockhole close to off stump, swiped down to long-on
full and wide, flayed away hard but straight to sweeper cover
length ball outside off, swatted down the ground to long-on
gone! Low full-toss, a bit of late swing into the left-hander. Miller shuffles across, looks to flick, and is hit on the back pad, as plumb as plumb can be. The end of a painful innings from Miller
back of a length on middle stump, stays leg-side of the ball and pushes with a straight bat through cover
low full-toss outside off, jabbed away to the left of the keeper

shortish outside off, punched away through point. They decide to risk a second, Billings throws to the bowler's end, and Zaheer is behind the stumps but doesn't really attempt to collect it, with the batsman a long way short - the throw bounced at an awkward spot, very near the stumps, in mitigation
short and wide and Axar deliberately slices underneath that cut to hit it up and over the short third man area. Third man is too square to be able to cut it off
yorker close to off stump, squeezed away through point
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to long leg
fullish, close to off stump, slogged away to the right of deep midwicket
full, a bit of width, and Mohit slices it away cleverly, over the gap between backward point and short third man
bang. That's full on off stump, and he clears his front leg and launches it flat, back over the bowler's head
this one's fuller and a little wider - close to being a wide yorker, and he opens his bat face and squeezes it down towards third man
slower ball slanted across the right-hander. Mohit looks to drive through cover, inside-out and the ball beats his outside edge
very full outside off. Clears his front leg and looks to slap it through cover, and is beaten again

full-toss on middle stump, a bit of late shape away. Wants to play through midwicket, initially, then has to adjust and open his bat face up, and ends up spooning it in the air, drops just short of the cover fielder diving forward
full-toss again, looks to slog over midwicket, doesn't time it at all, hits it on the bounce to long-on
very full, close to off stump, nearly a yorker. Can't connect cleanly with his attempted hit down the ground, gets a thickish inside edge that rolls into the straight midwicket area
yorker on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
leg-stump yorker. Gets his feet out of the way and squeezes it out to mid-off
low full-toss on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump. Looks to pull, not short enough for that, can only miscue towards long-off. Bounces well short of the fielder, though
full on off stump, underpitches the yorker, and Axar gets underneath and hits it high and hard, straight back over the bowler's head
full, angling in towards off stump. Chipped in the air, on the bounce to long-on
fullish slower ball on off stump, clipped back to the bowler
full, a bit of width, Axar clears his front leg and flat-bats over the covers, but doesn't time it too well, and it slows down three-fourths of its way to the boundary
dug in short, rises steeply over middle and off. Hops to ride the bounce, drops it into the covers with soft hands
length ball angling towards middle and leg. Looks to drive inside-out and inside-edges past his leg stump. Pant stops it with a tumble to his left
steps away from leg stump again, gets a length ball on middle stump, swings at it without too much of an idea of where he wants to hit it and ends up swiping it through backward square leg
slower short ball outside off, dabs straight to short third man and they chance a quick single. Mohit was yards short if Samson's throw had hit the stumps at the keeper's end
wide yorker, reaches out to stab at it, but can't connect
full on middle stump, punched to mid-off
short ball at the body, saw Axar try to make room and followed him. Manages to remain leg-side of the ball and opens his bat face to dab to short third man
full, following the batsman's movement away from leg stump. Mohit looks to swipe it through the leg side, misses, gets a bit of back pad on it to help it onto the stumps
full on middle stump, Cariappa makes a lot of room and flays it away to third man
Starts with a middle-stump yorker that sets the bails flashing  Cariappa tries to make room and squeeze that through point, and can't connect this time
low full-toss on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
wide yorker, slapped to the left of extra-cover and Zaheer moves quickly to stop it
slower yorker on off stump, manages to jam his bat down just in time to squeeze it out into the cover point region
yorker on leg stump, jabbed down to long-on - refuses the single
slower ball on a good length. Axar clears his front leg, slogs, and misses. The ball hits leg stump and Morris finishes with three wickets
